metadata.title: Linear programming: Ellipsoid method
metadata.description: In linear programming, the optimization problem is to find a point with optimal value that satisfies a set of constraints. In the separation problem, given a point, we have to find out if it satisfies all the constraints, and if it doesn't, find a violated constraint. It can be proven that a polynomial time algorithm for the separation problem can be used to solve the optimization problem in polynomial time via the Ellipsoid algorithm.
